fix(performance): Bypass Next.js image optimizer to enable browser caching

CRITICAL FIX: Images were being re-fetched from backend on every autoplay transition

THE PROBLEM:
- Next.js <Image> component proxies all requests through /_next/image optimizer
- This bypassed browser caching despite proper backend cache headers
- Every carousel transition triggered fresh backend requests
- Browser cache was never utilized

THE ROOT CAUSE:
- Backend serves properly optimized WebP thumbnails with cache headers
- Cache-Control: public, max-age=31536000, immutable (1 year cache)
- But Next.js optimizer intercepted all requests as intermediary
- Browser only cached Next.js''s optimized versions, not originals

THE FIX:
- Added unoptimized={true} to Image component
- Images now served directly from backend to browser
- Browser cache headers respected
- No performance loss (backend already serves optimized WebP)

IMPACT:
- Before: Every transition = backend request
- After: Images cached by browser, served from disk
- Network tab shows 304/cache hits instead of 200 requests
- Backend load eliminated during autoplay
